info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 6 at 3:55AM EDT until April 7 at 11:30PM EDT by NWS Northern Indiana
info.description:
...The National Weather Service in Northern Indiana has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Indiana...
Mississinewa River near Marion affecting Wabash, Grant and Miami Counties.
For the Mississinewa River...including Marion...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Mississinewa River near Marion.
* WHEN...From early this morning to late tomorrow evening.
* IMPACTS...At 12.8 feet, Flood waters cut off the Stone Crest Manor trailer park and the Quail Hollow neighborhood.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:45 AM EDT Sunday the stage was 12.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 2:45 AM EDT Sunday was 12.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 12.5 feet this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage late this evening. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Detailed river forecasts and additional information can be found at www.weather.gov/iwx under Rivers and Lakes.
The next statement will be issued by this afternoonthis evening at 1000 PM EDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM EARLY THIS MORNING TO LATE TOMORROW EVENING

area.areaDesc: Grant, IN; Miami, IN; Wabash, IN
